intro: Picris sonchoides var. flagellaris, commonly known as the flagellate goatweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a composite head. The leaves are typically alternate, lanceolate, and often have a rough texture. This variant is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. It is an annual herb that thrives in temperate climates and is known for its rapid growth and adaptability.
